187.description: Allows the family court, after a fact-finding hearing establishing paternity, to terminate the parental rights of a person convicted of sexual assault which resulted in the birth of a child.

188.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
188.title: Joint Committee Of The Repealer
188.description: Creates the joint committee of the repealer in the general assembly.

189.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
189.title: Litter Control And Recycling
189.description: Defines as "litter" any commercial/private/political sign/poster/notice subject to penalty provisions of §37-15-7.

190.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
190.description: Requires insurers to cover residential or inpatient treatment for mental health and/or substance abuse, and requires a consent for peer coaching services.

192.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
192.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act
192.description: Requires the insurance commissioner to issue regulations prohibiting the use of credit histories, credit scores, occupation or educational level in setting auto insurance rates.

193.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
193.title: Dealerships
193.description: Requires motor vehicle dealers to disclose in writing that a vehicle being sold has a spare tire/ jack or is otherwise equipped in compliance with applicable law. There shall be a civil penalty of $100 for a violation under this subsection.

194.title: Real Estate Brokers And Salespersons
194.description: Requires a real estate broker to release customer or client funds in an escrow account as instructed by the parties to a failed real estate transaction, within ten (10) days of receipt of a written release.

195.title: Condominium Law - Insurance
195.description: Entitles a condominium owner to obtain a copy of a damage appraisal within fourteen days.

196.title: Small Cell Siting Act
196.description: Establishes the "Small Cell Siting Act", which specifies how local authorities may regulate the collocation of small wireless facilities and small wireless facility networks.

198.title: Retail Licenses
198.description: Permits the Providence licensing board to issue a Class C liquor license for premises at 215 Dean Street.

199.title: Delegation Of Non-ablative Treatments
199.description: Provides guidelines for the delegation by licensed health care professionals of non-ablative laser or energy-based treatments to a properly-qualified delegate.

200.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
200.title: The Youth Protection Act
200.description: Requires persons who provide volunteer services with youth serving agencies to get a national criminal records check.

201.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
201.title: Municipal Police Arbitration
201.description: Relieves municipal police unions of their obligation to represent non-member employees, in the grievance process, if they haven't been union members for 90 days before the grievance event.

202.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
202.title: State Employees Arbitration
202.description: Relieves state employee unions of their obligation to represent non-member employees, in the grievance process, if they haven't been union members for 90 days before the grievance event.

203.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
203.title: Municipal Employees' Arbitration
203.description: Relieves municipal employees' unions of their obligation to represent nonmember employees, in the grievance process, if they haven't been union members for 90 days before the grievance event.

204.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Middletown
204.description: Validates and ratify an amendment to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Middletown, which amendment was adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Middletown on November 8, 2016.

205.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
205.title: Rhode Island Comprehensive Planning And Land Use Act
205.description: Requires municipality comprehensive plans to include present and future interests of the school system including curriculum and instruction as well as buildings, transportation routes, fields, playgrounds, sidewalks, raised crosswalks and parking lots.

206.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
206.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes
206.description: Provides that estates in Rhode Island be taxed at a rate equal to the maximum credit for state death taxes allowed by the federal revenue act, which exemption is set at five million, four hundred ninety thousand dollars ($5,490,000) in 2017.

207.title: State Lottery - Disbursement Of Revenue
207.description: Directs profits from the state lottery into a restricted receipt account to be disbursed as state aid to education.

208.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

209.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
209.title: Low And Moderate Income Housing
209.description: Provides for increases in the amount of foundation level school support that a community would receive, based upon a community's ability to meet and surpass its minimum low and moderate income housing requirements.

210.title: Independent Charter Schools
210.description: Provides that the office of auditor general be responsible for analyzing and reporting the impact of new or expanded charter schools.

211.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
211.title: State Purchases
211.description: Increases the minimum amount of state purchases subject to competitive bidding from $10,000 to $50,000 for construction and from $5,000 to $20,000 for all other purchases.

212.title: Public Transit-- Bus Passes
212.description: Requires that five million dollars ($5,000,000) be appropriated to the Rhode Island public transit authority between July 1, 2017 and June 30, 2019.

213.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
213.title: Relating To Human Services-- Automobile Accident Social Protection Act
213.description: Creates an accident compensation fund to provide payments and benefits to those injured by uninsured motorists, to be administered by the DHS.

214.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
214.title: Public Corporation Debt Management
214.description: Prohibits the general assembly and any governmental or quasi-governmental entity created by it, from issuing moral obligation bonds not secured by the full faith and credit of the state or revenues.

217.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
217.title: Sales And Use Taxes
217.description: Provides that effective January 1, 2018, delivery charges would not be subject to either a sales or use tax.

219.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
219.title: Relating To Taxation-- Public Service Corporation Tax
219.description: Clarifies depreciation with respect to the net book value of a company's tangible personal property, by providing that the accumulated depreciation reduction takes into account physical deterioration and functional and economic obsolescence.

220.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

220.description: Requires cities and towns to use the National Automobile Dealers Association (NADA) trade-in value for motor vehicles assessed as of December 31, 2016 and thereafter for purposes of the tangible personal property tax.

221.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

222.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
222.title: The Rhode Island Aging And Disability Resource Center
222.description: Establishes aging/disability resource center within division of elderly affairs as part of long-term care system for elderly/disabled persons/family caregivers/providers.

223.description: Requires the resource recovery corporation to pay the town of Johnston annually six million dollars ($6,000,000) in addition to any other tipping fees paid to the town by the corporation.

224.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
224.title: Personal Income--military Survivor Benefits
224.description: Exempts from income tax any survivor benefits received by a widow or widower by virtue of a deceased spouse's military service.

226.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
226.title: Highways - Loitering
226.description: Makes loitering in a public highway or on certain median strips a misdemeanor subject to a fine not less than one hundred dollars ($100) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500).

229.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
229.title: Indictments, Informations And Complaints
229.description: Eliminates the statute of limitations for second-degree sexual assault.

232.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

232.description: Increases penalties for damages to electric and communication lines from three thousand dollars ($3,000) to fifty thousand dollars ($50,000); imprisonment from two (2) years to ten (10) years, or both and requires restitution for economic harm.

233.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
233.title: Foreclosed Property Upkeep Act

234.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
234.title: Fair Housing Practices
234.description: Prohibits discrimination in housing against those persons who have a lawful source of income.

235.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
235.title: Public Records--restoration Of Voting Rights
235.description: Requires the department of corrections to provide certain nonprofit organizations with a list containing information about formerly incarcerated inmates who have become eligible to vote to assist in their efforts in registering former felons to vote.

236.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

236.description: Requires the department of corrections to provide the secretary of state with the number of eligible persons who, upon release from incarceration, have registered to vote and requires the secretary of state to publish that number twice a year.

238.description: Authorizes the town of Foster to provide tax credits to the elderly and disabled.

239.title: Relating To The Coventry Fire District
239.description: Changes the date of the annual meeting of the Coventry Fire District from the second Tuesday of December to the second Wednesday of November.

240.description: Expands the renewable energy growth program for an additional ten (10) years after the fifth program year, with an annual target of forty (40) nameplate megawatts for each year of the ten (10) year period.

241.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
241.title: Genetically Modified Organisms

242.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

242.description: Requires persons seeking certain forms of public assistance to attend a financial literacy seminar.

248.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

248.description: Exempts the trade-in values of motorcycles from sales tax.

250.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

250.description: Provides that for the purpose of determining income limitations for receiving general public assistance, child support that is in arrears for thirty (30) days or more would not be considered to be income.

253.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

254.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

262.description: Requires that when a judge of color on a state or municipal court leaves the bench, they would be replaced by a person of color.

264.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

270.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

279.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

280.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Shannon Systems, Llc

281.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Itw Food Equipment Group Llc
281.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Itw Food Equipment Group Llc

284.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

286.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services

288.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

290.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

293.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

296.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

304.description: Prohibits municipal charters and ordinances from requiring that their police officers and firefighters reside within the state of Rhode Island.

308.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

309.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

312.description: Provides that, effective September 1, 2017, all Central Falls retirees covered by the Central Falls retirees' settlement agreement would have their pension benefits gradually increased from 75% to 100% of their base pension benefit amount as of 7/31/11.

317.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

319.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

320.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

320.description: Approval and funding of drug awareness programs for minors placed with the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals.

321.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

321.description: Reduces the number of jobs to be created for eligibility for the jobs incentive program.

322.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
322.title: Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
322.description: Reduces the alcoholic beverage manufacturing and wholesale licensing fee from three thousand dollars ($3,000) to five hundred dollars ($500).

325.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

326.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

326.description: Exempts from the sales and use tax the sale of beer and malt beverages at retail.

327.description: Requires audio and video recordings of certain open meetings and posting of said recordings on secretary of state's website.

328.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

331.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

332.description: Abolishes fees imposed upon Rhode Island residents and businesses operating within the state for the collection, transportation, storage or recycling of any mattress after January 1, 2018.

333.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

334.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

335.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

335.description: Establishes a prescription drug review commission to develop a list of critical prescription drugs for which there is a substantial public interest in understanding the development of its pricing.

337.description: Prohibits the use of a stingray cell-site simulator device by any law enforcement agency except upon application for its use and the granting of its order by the presiding justice of the superior court.

339.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

339.description: Precludes parental disability serving as basis for denial/restrictions involving matters of a child's welfare/foster care/family law/guardianship/adoption without written findings by the family court.

340.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

341.description: Imposes a penalty of two thousand dollars ($2,000) upon financial institutions failing to promptly record foreclosure deeds and pay outstanding taxes.

342.title: Use Of Lanes
342.description: Makes a violation using the passing lane on limited access highways when not passing another vehicle.

343.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

343.description: Requires all candidates for United States President and Vice President file copies of their last five (5) years of federal income tax returns with the state board of elections no later than fifty (50) days prior to the general election.

344.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

349.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of East Greenwich
349.description: Validates and ratify amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of East Greenwich, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of East Greenwich on November 8, 2016.

351.description: Repeals §14-1-61 regarding payment of costs/expenses for certain complaints filed in family court, and chapter 4 of title 14, which established the O'Rourke Children's Center and regulated procedures relating to the placement of children at the center.

352.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

353.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

354.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

356.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

356.description: Requires each member of the board of education to have experience in a position of higher education.

357.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

357.description: Provides an income tax credit of twenty-five percent (25%) of an elderly resident taxpayers primary residence water and sewer bills, not to exceed $250.

360.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

362.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

366.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
366.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits--apprenticeship Program

368.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
368.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
368.description: Exempts natural hair braiders from the requirement to be licensed as hairdressers or cosmeticians, and defines the practice of natural hair braiding.

370.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
370.title: Uniform Recognition And Enforcement Of Canadian Domestic Violence Protection Orders Act
370.description: Enacts uniform recognition of Canadian domestic violence protection orders act to conform law to other enacting states.

371.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
371.title: Elective Share
371.description: Clarifies the surviving spouse's right regarding elective shares against the decedent's will as to real and personal estate for decedents dying on and after January 1, 2017.

372.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
372.title: Contractors' Registration And Licensing Board
372.description: Distinguishes the criminal penalties for violations of final order of contractors' registration board based on the amount of the monetary amount on the final orders with orders in excess of $5,000 deemed felonies and less than $5,000 deemed misdemeanors.

373.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
373.title: Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access To Digital Assets Act
373.description: Regulates fiduciary and designated recipient access to digital assets relating to probate practice and procedure by creating the "Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act" to promote uniformity of the law among states that enact it.

374.title: Limited Guardianship And Guardianship Of Adults
374.description: Increases the guardianship ad litem maximum fee from $400 to $800 in guardian/limited guardianship proceedings.

375.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
375.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--procedure Generally--levy And Sale On Execution
375.description: Requires attachments and executions to describe real estate with particularity by using the recorded legal description, or metes and bounds, street address or assessors plat and lot number.

376.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
376.title: Born-alive Infant Protection Act
376.description: Enacts the Born-Alive Infant Protection Act and provide for the duties and obligations of medical personnel in certain circumstances.

377.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
377.title: Fetal Protection Act
377.description: Establishes the Fetal Protection Act, establishing certain actions to unborn children as crimes.

378.title: Voting Booth
378.description: Raises the age of children that can accompany a voter in the voter booth, from under the age of thirteen (13) years to under the age of eighteen (18) years.

379.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Judiciary
379.title: Tax Sales
379.description: Expedites the foreclosure procedure on vacant property, and amends the provisions of the RIGL on tax sales in order to establish priorities of tax liens, clarify the effect of late recordings and simplify procedures in the event of a void sale.

380.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
380.title: Trust
380.description: Permits trust settlor to provide for trust advisor/trust protector to direct actions of trustee and establishes their legal responsibilities applying to all past/future trusts.

381.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
381.title: Contractors’ Registration And Licensing Board
381.description: Requires an applicant for any license or registration issued by the contractors’ registration and licensing board to undergo a national criminal records check.

383.title: All Students Count Act
383.description: Requires the department of elementary and secondary education to use separate collection categories and tabulations for specified Asian ethnic groups in every demographic report on ancestry or ethnic origins of residents.

385.title: Child Restraint Systems
385.description: Requires infants and toddlers under two (2) years of age or weighing less than thirty pounds (30 lbs.) be retrained in rear-facing car seats.

387.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
387.title: Property Tax Relief
387.description: Increases the income range and the maximum credit amount for the property tax relief extended to elderly and/or disabled persons.

388.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
388.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
388.description: Provides for a reduction to local per pupil funding for state-operated schools that do not have teachers who participate in the state teacher's retirement system.

389.title: State Aid
389.description: Allows cities, towns, and school districts to cease implementation of state mandates up to 50% of reimbursement shortfall.

390.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
390.title: Soil Conservation
390.description: Provides for an annual appropriation to be given to the state conservation committee.

391.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
391.title: Relating To Public Officers And Employees
391.description: Moves state employee public safety professionals from the state retirement system to the municipal retirement system, effective July 1, 2017. It sets their retirement contribution to 10% of their compensation.

392.title: Establishment Of Regional School Districts - Chariho Career And Technical Center
392.description: Provides department of education shall not approve a new career and technical program or center in certain towns so long as a center is maintained by the Chariho regional school district.

393.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/15/2017)
393.title: Relating To Health And Safety- Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
393.description: Creates Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act to provide mechanism for terminally ill patient to choose to end their life using physician prescribed drugs.

394.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
394.description: Allows information contained in the prescription drug monitoring database to be disclosed to a certified law enforcement drug diversion investigator of a qualified law enforcement agency.

397.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
397.title: Board Of Regents For Elementary And Secondary Education
397.description: Requires that the council of elementary and secondary education take into consideration the time and cost of transporting students and other programs that impact the education of students.

398.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
398.title: Office Of State Medical Examiners
398.description: Allows legal guardians to notify the medical examiner that the performance of an autopsy was against a family's religious beliefs. Friends, without legal status, would no longer be able to provide this information.

399.title: The Naturopathic Physicians Act Of 2017
399.description: Establishes procedures for the licensing of doctors of naturopathy, who provide health care utilizing natural substance and therapies. Doctors of naturopathy would be subject to oversight by the director of the Rhode Island department of health.

400.title: Subdivision Of Land
400.description: Shortens the time periods related to certifications, decision-making and recordings of decisions for major land development and major subdivision master and preliminary plans.

401.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
401.title: Zoning Ordinances
401.description: Establishes a separate variance process for certain properties that sustain damages as a result of a state emergency or local disaster emergency.

402.title: Animal Care
402.description: Requires that municipal animal control officers be certified by the National Care & Control Association.

403.title: Rhode Island Sailing Events Commission
403.description: Creates the Rhode Island Sailing Events Commission in order to attract amateur and professional marine events in Rhode Island.

404.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
404.title: Employment Security
404.description: Creates a seasonal employment designation for purposes of unemployment insurance, which would allow employers regularly hiring employees on a recurring basis for less than 20 weeks to apply for a seasonal determination from the DTL.

405.title: Wildlife Management Areas
405.description: Replaces language referencing DEM park police and conservation police with environmental police officers.

406.title: Relating To Waters And Navigation-rhode Island Underground Storage Tank Financial Responsibility Act
406.description: Amends the Rhode Island Underground Storage Tank Financial Responsibility Act to streamline fund processes and clarify language within the law.

407.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
407.title: Pharmacies
407.description: Imposes duty upon manufacturers/wholesalers to dispense drugs timely to persons with "immediate need" despite dispute with health insurer and provides for hearing process to settle dispute.

408.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
408.description: Amends electric distribution companies authority to charge interconnecting renewable energy customers for certain modifications and places timetables on interconnection work.

409.title: Quonset Development Corporation
409.description: Provides that the Quonset Development Corporation may purchase and obtain water service from any city, town, water district, or other water supply authority.

410.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
410.title: Transportation Network Company Services - Insurance
410.description: Requires TNC drivers maintain commercial automobile liability insurance 24/7 and to park no closer than two hundred feet (200') from marked taxi stands.

412.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
412.title: Motor Carrier Transportation Contracts
412.description: Renders void/unenforceable motor transportation contract terms holding harmless indemnitee from or against its own negligence/intentional acts/omissions upon the effective date.

413.title: Barbers And Hairdressers
413.description: Reduces the number of hours of instruction required to obtain a hairdresser's and cosmetician's license from fifteen hundred (1,500) to twelve hundred (1,200) hours.

414.title: Transfer Of Vehicles
414.description: Includes automobiles equipped with self-sealing tires to be exempt from having a spare tire and jack when sold.

415.title: Regulations Of Business Practices Among Motor Vehicle Manufacturers, Distributors, And Dealers
415.description: Requires auto manufacturers to compensate dealers for vehicles subject to "stop-sale" or "do-not-drive" orders.

416.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
416.title: Pay For Success Criminal Recidivism Reduction Act
416.description: Provides for the contracting with criminal justice reform services which provide Pay for Success criminal justice reform programs.

417.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
417.title: Motor Vehicles Reparations Act
417.description: Amends the fine imposed for reinstatement of the license or registration of an owner of a motor vehicle following the revocation or suspension of the license or registration for failure to maintain financial security.

419.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
419.title: Retirement System - Contributions And Benefits
419.description: Removes some of the restrictions on post-retirement re-employment of public employees.

420.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
420.title: Relating To Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities And Hospitals -- Mental Health Consumer Advocates Of Rhode Island -- Oasis Wellness And Recovery Center
420.description: Establishes a mental health consumer advocate and wellness recovery center to provide support for those suffering from mental health issues and would appropriate two-hundred ninety five thousand dollars ($295,000) to operate the program.

423.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
423.title: Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act
423.description: Establishes the Rhode Island early childhood innovation fund for the purpose of supporting programs to close the achievement gap that currently exists for at-risk children as they enter kindergarten.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: Registration Plates
424.description: Permits the motor vehicle administration to allow auctions of registration plates for charity.

427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
427.title: Sexual Offender Registration And Notification
427.description: Implements the federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (SORNA) (Title I of Public Law 109-248).

428.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
428.title: Retirement Allowance
428.description: Grants an annual increase of three percent (3%) cost-of-living retirement adjustment on the first fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000) of a retiree's annual allowance.

429.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
429.title: Retirement Fund Investment
429.description: Prohibits the state investment commission from investing in any companies that are involved in the construction of a border wall between the United States and Mexico.

430.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
430.title: Cigarette Tax-minimum Price Of Cigarettes
430.description: Requires that a fifteen percent (15%) minimum markup be added to the total cost of cigarettes sold by retailers.

431.title: Department Of Children, Youth And Families
431.description: Expands the definition of child for the purpose of eligibility to receive DCYF services, including foster care, to any person under the age of 21 who began to receive child welfare services from the DCYF prior to reaching age 18.

432.title: State Departments' Cooperation
432.description: Facilitates the sharing of information between the treasury, state retirement system, division of taxation, and the department of labor and training concerning unclaimed property, taxation collection, and pension benefit monitoring.

434.title: Domestic Assault - Protect Rhode Island Families Act
434.description: Limits access to firearms when an individual is under certain types of domestic restraining orders or protective orders issued or renewed on or after July 1, 2017.

435.title: Mail Ballots--in-person Early Voting
435.description: Ends the voting of mail ballots at local board of canvassers. It also authorizes in-person early voting effective July 1, 2018, with the actual procedures to be established by rules promulgated by the state board of elections.

436.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
436.title: Open Meetings
436.description: Requires the attorney general to, within ninety (90) days of a complaint alleging a violation of the open meetings law, file a report detailing the results of the investigation into that complaint. The report would be deemed a public record.

437.title: Registration Of Voters
437.description: Provides that persons who apply to the DMV for a driver's license, its renewal or personal identification simultaneously register to vote, unless they expressly decline to do so. It also requires that the person certify that they are an American citizen.

438.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
438.title: Immigration Detainees
438.description: Creates standards for responding to immigration detainees for the law enforcement officials' transportation of inmates, who are the subject of immigration detainers or administrative warrants.

439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
439.title: Search Warrants
439.description: Requires the sealing of an application for a search warrant unless the court issuing the warrant issues an order granting relief from the seal.

441.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
441.title: Cell Phone Tracking
441.description: Allows for the issuance of a court order to secure cell phone location information and changes the notice requirements needed to be provided for that type if court orders.

442.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
442.title: Atlantic Time Zone
442.description: Provides for Rhode Island's adoption of the Atlantic Time Zone if and when Massachusetts does so.

445.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
445.title: Multi-unit Residence Safety Act
445.description: Permits tenants of multi-unit residences to terminate their lease agreements if no action is taken to remedy the presence of secondhand smoke.

446.title: Self-insurance Of Developmental Disability Agencies
446.description: Authorizes operators of developmental disability agencies, acting as a group, to self-insure health care costs for employees, retirees and other beneficiaries and allows a third-party administrator to administer said program.

447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
447.title: Infertility
447.description: Provides insurance for infertility regardless of marital status.

448.title: Electronic Confirmation And Compliance System
448.description: Creates an electronic automobile and commercial vehicle liability insurance confirmation and compliance system in the state.

450.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
450.title: Public Utilities Commission
450.description: Requires all public utilities to maintain a customer service facility within the state to perform services such as addressing customer inquiries and accepting bill payments.

451.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
451.title: Cable Billing
451.description: Requires cable television companies to give their customers the option to purchase, at its fair market value, a device which decodes their digital cable signals.

452.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
452.title: Revenue Decoupling
452.description: Directs the public utilities commission to review and approve the electric distribution company's use of real estate and other capital assets and expenditures.

455.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
455.title: Plastic Waste Reduction
455.description: Establishes a plan for a ban on the use of disposable plastic checkout bags by retail establishments.

456.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
456.title: Reduce Marine Debris And Preserve Landfill Space While Increasing The Recycling Of Post-consumer Packaging Material
456.description: Creates the Rhode Island marine debris act for the purpose of reducing the amount of post-consumer packaging that ends up as marine and beach debris.

459.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
459.title: Condominium Law
459.description: Changes newspaper notice publication requirements and grants defaulting unit owner rights of post-sale notice and rights of redemption.

460.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
460.title: Computer Crime
460.description: Prohibits unauthorized access to confidential information from a computer, computer program, computer system, or computer network.

462.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
462.title: Department Of Attorney General - Gun Crimes Report
462.description: Directs the attorney general to report annually to the general assembly on the incidence and disposition of crimes involving guns.

463.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
463.title: Possession Of Firearms By Minors
463.description: Requires all minors in possession of a firearm, with or without a permit, be in the presence of a parent or guardian or supervising adult at all times.

466.title: Student Journalists' Freedom Of Expression Act
466.description: Creates the Student Journalists' Freedom of Expression Act protecting student journalists' right to exercise freedom of speech in school-sponsored media.

467.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
467.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-trespass And Vandalism
467.description: Makes it civil violation for commercial property owners to allow storm water runoff to flood, erode or otherwise damage abutting property. Violations of this section would be punishable by a civil fine and order of restitution.

468.title: Divorce And Separation
468.description: Allows for incarceration of an individual to be taken into consideration for the purposes of a motion to modify a child support order.

470.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
470.title: Adult Use Of Cannabis Act
470.description: Establishes a system for the regulation and taxation for adult use and cultivation of marijuana.

471.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
471.title: Pets--custody
471.description: Requires the best interest of a domestic animal to be considered in awarding possession to a party to the action.

472.title: Rhode Island Junior/senior High/middle School Student Assistance Act
472.description: Extends the junior/senior high/middle school student assistance program to include senior high school students and identify the student assistance program/project success as a recipient of the funds.

475.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
475.title: Relating To Human Services-child Care-state Subsidies
475.description: Requires the department to establish a database which monitors copayments owed by families receiving child care assistance. There is no cost to certified family-child care providers and a reasonable fee to providers not receiving payments.

476.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
476.title: Child Care--state Subsidies
476.description: Raises the maximum reimbursement rate for licensed child care providers by five percent (5%).

478.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
478.title: Contractors' Bonds
478.description: Prohibits state, general contractors, and construction managers from withholding a retainer of more than five percent (5%) from public works contracts.

479.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
479.title: Housing Resources
479.description: Enables the general assembly to appropriate not less than five million dollars annually in capital financing for affordable housing development.

480.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
480.title: Organ Donors' Leave
480.description: Provides up to thirty (30) paid days in a calendar year to serve as an organ donor for state and municipal employees.

481.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
481.title: Fees
481.description: Raises the jurors' fees for each day's attendance on the superior court to twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per day commencing July 1, 2018 and increases to thirty-five dollars ($35.00) per day commencing July 1, 2019 and thereafter.

483.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
483.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance-work On Holidays And Sundays
483.description: Repeals §25-3-7 of the general laws which gives the director of the department of labor and training the authority to exempt certain classes of employees form receiving overtime pay for Sunday and holiday work.

484.title: Relating To Taxation-- Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes
484.description: Provides for a proration of the homestead exemption in cases where title to property passes from those not entitled to claim an exemption to those who are entitled.

485.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions
485.description: Names the roundabout at the intersection of Division Road and New England Tech Boulevard in East Greenwich the "Michael B. Isaacs Roundabout".

488.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
488.title: General Powers - Landing Fee For Town Of Bristol
488.description: Permits Bristol to charge $.35 landing fee on passengers over 12 years old arriving in its port excluding commercial fishing vessels.

489.title: Statewide Municipal Solar Permit
489.description: Requires the Rhode Island office of energy resources, in consultation with the building commission to promulgate rules and regulations to create a statewide solar photovoltaic permit application.

491.title: Governor's Council On Behavior Health
491.description: Increases membership of council from 26 to 31 voting members with amendments to reflect current names of state depts./divisions/agencies listed in statute.

493.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils--food And Beverages
493.description: Prohibits the sale and advertising of unhealthy food and beverage products in schools during the school day, since they do not meet minimum federal governmental nutrition standards.

494.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
494.title: Education Of Limited English Proficient Students
494.description: Prohibits the administration of standardized state-wide assessments or similar tests to students identified as limited English proficient students prior to September 1, 2020.

495.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
495.title: Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact
495.description: Authorizes the governor to enter into the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact and would designate an office to administer this compact.

497.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
497.title: Department Of Labor And Training
497.description: Makes it easier for military service members and their spouses to obtain certifications and licenses issued by the department of labor and training.

498.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
498.title: Division Of Motor Vehicles
498.description: Makes it easier for military service members and their spouses to obtain certifications and licenses issued by the division of motor vehicles and the department of administration.

499.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
499.title: Fees For State Colleges And Universities - Veterans
499.description: Requires the council on postsecondary education to develop a policy to exempt veterans from any and all application fees at all Rhode Island public postsecondary institutions.

500.title: Arbitration -- Continuance Of Contractual Provisions
500.description: Requires that the contractual provisions contained in and an otherwise expired collective bargaining agreement with certified school teachers and municipal employees continue until a successor agreement has been reached between the parties.

502.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
502.title: Wages
502.description: Gradually increases the hourly minimum wage from $9.60 to $15.00 on January 1, 2022, as well as gradually increasing the hourly minimum wage for employees receiving gratuities from $3.89 an hour to $15.00 an hour on January 1, 2026.

503.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
503.title: Overtime Wages
503.description: Exempts certain executive, administrative, and professional employees from overtime pay if their weekly wages exceed one thousand thirty-six dollars ($1,036), an increase from the current two hundred dollars ($200).

504.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
504.title: Police And Fire Arbitrations
504.description: Allows expired collective bargaining agreements for firefighters and municipal police to remain in effect until a successor agreement becomes operative.

505.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
505.title: State Police - Diversity
505.description: Beginning June 30, 2018, requires 1 in 5 recruits to the Rhode Island State Police Training Academy be a person of color and also requires vigorous recruitment effort.

507.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
507.title: State Police - Equal Employment Opportunity
507.description: Establishes an equal opportunity unit within the division of state police to adopt an equal opportunity plan to increase the ranks of minorities and women among members of the state police.

508.title: Optional Retirement For Members Of Police And Firefighters
508.description: Adds illness sustained while in the performance of duty to the definition of accidental disability.

509.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
509.title: Labor And Payment Of Debts By Contractors
509.description: Raises the minimum threshold when public works contractors are required to pay prevailing wages to their employees from $1,000 to $200,000.

511.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
511.title: Temporary Disability Insurance - Coverage
511.description: Allows Rhode Island residents who work for an out-of-state nongovernmental employer to apply for coverage under Rhode Island's Temporary Disability Insurance program.

512.title: Unlawful Confinement Of A Covered Animal
512.description: Defines covered animals and prohibits their abuse and sale.

513.title: Geoengineering
513.description: Defines geoengineering and requires permission of director of DEM to implement solar radiation management and climate geoengineering.

514.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
514.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety
514.description: Requires any person who sustains an injury to themselves or causes an injury to another while hunting or trapping to report the injury to the department of environmental management immediately.

515.title: Administrative Penalties For Environmental Violations
515.description: Increases the administrative penalties that the director of DEM may impose for violations of environmental regulations up to five thousand dollars ($5,000).

516.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
516.title: Water Supply Facilities
516.description: Increases WRB membership from 15 to 23 members consisting of 12 public representatives and 11 members associated with various public agencies.

517.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Scituate-foster Little League
517.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Scituate-foster Little League

518.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Fortney & Weygandt, Inc.
518.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Fortney & Weygandt, Inc.

519.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
519.title: Community Obligations And Banking Offenses
519.description: Requires licensed financial institutions to post signage advising of fraudulent financial schemes and need for caution in related financial transactions effective January 1, 2018.

521.title: Division Of Fire Safety
521.description: Bars adjusters and contractors from premises under investigation by the fire marshal until premises are released, and provides penalties for violation.

525.title: Real Estate Appraisal Management Companies
525.description: Provides for the registration and oversight of appraisal management companies operating in this state.

526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
526.title: Solicitation By Charitable Organizations
526.description: Requires professional solicitors and fund-raisers to disclose name of employer and percentage of contribution solicited by the fundraiser that will be retained by fundraising company. Requires that a specific statement be made with all solicitations.

527.title: Forms And Effect Of Conveyances
527.description: Provides that all transfers of a mortgage interest on residential property be recorded so as to provide a clean chain of title for consumers to track the owner of their mortgage loans.

530.title: Retail Licenses -- Tastings
530.description: Amends the statute on wine and beer, and distilled spirit sampling or tastings to permit the wholesaler to supply free product to Class A licensees for use in such sampling or tastings.

531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
531.title: Communication Access Services
531.description: Requires insurance plans to include coverage for effective communication access services between patients who are deaf and their healthcare professionals in order to ensure that their health needs and treatments are understood.

532.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
532.title: Dental Health Coverage
532.description: Permits dental patients of five health care providers to assign their dental benefits to dentist of their choice.

533.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
533.title: Life Insurance
533.description: Requires that the department of business regulation provide a mandatory disclosure notice, at no cost to insurers, to certain policy holders regarding their rights and alternatives to lapse or surrender.

534.title: Casualty Insurance Rating
534.description: Repeals the provision prohibiting employer's liability and the surplus lines insurance multi-state compact as outdated statutes governing insurance.

535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
535.title: Physical Therapy Copay
535.description: Limits copays, coinsurance or office deductible for services of a physical therapist to the amount authorized for medical and osteopathic physician office visits.

536.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
536.title: Insurance Consumer Protection Sales Act
536.description: Creates a system of consumer protection for regulation by DBR of noninsurance business entities in disclosing personal identifiable financial information for insurance sales.

539.title: Relating To Insurance Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies
539.description: Permits an audit or claims investigation for a pattern of inappropriate billing only if it is determined that the claims are known by the provider to be inappropriate.

540.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
540.title: Health Insurance - Required Provisions
540.description: Requires health insurance providers to disclose to subscribers the potential cost of using out-of-network providers.

542.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
542.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Health And Substance Abuse Disorders
542.description: Defines coinsurance and prohibits insurance contracts or policies from using coinsurance to calculate and collect additional funds from patients, including mental health and substance abuse patients.

543.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
543.title: Water Suppliers
543.description: Exempts residential water customers over sixty-five (65) from paying surcharges on their basic water supply rate.

550.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
550.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers
550.description: Permits agents of a public utility to enter a premises where gas or electricity is supplied under certain circumstances.

551.title: Rhode Island Business Corporation Act
551.description: Substitutes CPA certification that a corporation/limited partnership/limited liability company owes no taxes/fees to the state in place of a conversions/dissolutions/withdrawals/cancellations.

552.title: Rhode Island Nonprofit Corporation Act
552.description: Simplifies process for foreign corporations to obtain certificate of authority by producing only certificate of good standing legal assistance from incorporating state or country.

553.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
553.title: Transportation Network Company Services
553.description: Subjects TNC vehicle owners to the regulation of transportation network companies.

554.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
554.title: Taxicab Licenses
554.description: Places a ten (10) year moratorium on the issuance of new taxicab and limited public motor vehicles certificates but not affect current certificates.

556.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
556.title: Municipal Streetlight Investment Act
556.description: Amends provisions relative to municipalities purchase or lease of lighting equipment from electric distribution companies.

558.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
558.title: Produce Scales In Markets
558.description: Requires sealers of weights and measures appointed by the cities and towns to receive the same fees as charged by state sealers who perform the same inspecting/testing services.

559.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
559.title: Relating To Building Permit Fees
559.description: Requires that city and town building permit fees recover no more than the cost of permitting activities during period of normal building activity.

560.title: Rhode Island Development Impact Fee Act
560.description: Amends several sections of the general laws pertaining to the calculation of impact fees by municipalities in the state by requiring that needs assessments of the fees be conducted every 5 years with certain exceptions.

561.title: Retail Licenses - Providence
561.description: Enables the city of Providence's board of licenses to approve the liquor license applications for a business at 100-102 Hope Street (Assessor's plat 16, lot 263), located within two hundred feet (200') of a church.

562.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
562.title: Veterans' Property Exemptions
562.description: Authorizes the town of Coventry to enact an ordinance granting a $1,000 exemption to any person who was a member of the National Guard for not less than 5 consecutive yrs or served in a National Guard unit that was called to active duty by the President.

563.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
563.title: Property Subject To Taxation-veterans' Exemptions
563.description: Gives cities and towns the option of entirely exempting the homestead of a disabled veteran or their surviving spouse from taxation.

564.title: State Building Code
564.description: Expands the composition of the state building code standards committee by adding two (2) members, to be appointed from the Rhode Island builders association.

565.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
565.title: State Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act -- Duties Of Commissioner]
565.description: Directs the commissioner of elementary and secondary education to issue regulations banning cell phone possession by students in the public schools during the school day.

566.title: Private Schools
566.description: Requires accreditation by a Regional Accrediting Agency recognized by the United States Department of Education for distance learning institutions to transact business or grant degrees in Rhode Island.

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
570.title: Civic Literacy
570.description: Requires the commissioner of elementary and secondary education to adopt a course of study on the nation's founding and related documents, including the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, and the Federalist Papers.

572.title: Equal Rights Of Blind And Deaf Persons To Public Facilities
572.description: Requires movie theaters to provide open captioning for persons who are deaf or hard-of-hearing.

573.title: Physical Therapists
573.description: Modernizes the definition of physical therapy, the right to use the title of physical therapist and includes practice beyond the scope of physical therapy as a grounds for discipline.

574.title: Psychologists
574.description: Increases psychology board from 5 to 7 members and allows delegations of disciplinary hearings to a hearing officer.

575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
575.title: Patient Access Expansion Act
575.description: Prohibits the state from requiring any form of the Federation of State Medical Boards' proprietary maintenance of licensure program.

576.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
576.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
576.description: Grants reciprocity to physicians in other states and foreign jurisdictions upon submission of application/evidence meeting all requirements applicable to resident physicians to the board of medical licensure.

578.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
578.title: The Consumer Protection In Eye Care Act
578.description: Provides consumer protection in eye care services by developing standards and enforcement protocols related to the utilization of emergent technologies in the provision of eye care services, as well as for the delegation of eye care services by providers.

579.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
579.title: Rhode Island Food Drugs And Cosmetics Act
579.description: Requires food packaging to disclose that food has been packaged in reduced or modified oxygen, including a list of the gasses used, the percentage of each gas used, and the date the food was packaged.

580.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
580.title: Treatment For Patients With Terminal Illness--the Rhode Island Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act Of 2017
580.description: Creates the "Rhode Island Terminally Ill Patient's Right to Try Act of 2017," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

582.title: Rhode Island Fair Housing Practices Act
582.description: Guarantees persons with service animals reasonable access to housing provided the service animal does not provide a direct threat to the health and safety of others.

583.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
583.title: Equipment And Accessories Generally
583.description: Requires all new school buses purchased or leased be equipped with seat belts for each passenger and operator seat and further requires mandatory safety belt use by the school bus operator and each passenger.

584.title: Sexually Transmitted Diseases
584.description: Repeals the law which provides enhanced penalties of a fine of not more than $250/ imprisonment for not more than 6 months for disclosure of health care information with respect to an individual diagnosis and treatment of a sexually transmitted disease.

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
585.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools
585.description: Provides an exception to required school immunizations for pupils whose personal beliefs are contrary to immunization and/or testing.

586.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
586.title: Protecting Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
586.description: Establishes certain student privacy rights in regard to take-home technology devices from school.

587.title: The Rhode Island Children's Crusade For Higher Education
587.description: Establishes the college crusade of Rhode Island, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization registered with the Rhode Island secretary of state, as the entity that will administer and operate all program services and manage scholarship resources.

589.last_action: Senate passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
589.title: Road Test
589.description: At no cost to the state, allows a person who is bilingual or not proficient in the English language, to be assisted in their road test by a translator of their native language who is at least eighteen (18) years of age.

590.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
590.title: Operators' License
590.description: Allows the DMV to issue driving privilege licenses and driving privilege permits to applicants unable to establish lawful presence in the United States. Driving privilege licenses and driving privilege permits are not valid for identification purposes.

594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
594.title: Applicability Of Traffic Regulations
594.description: Provides that a person driving an automobile who is exercising due care and injures another person who is participating in a protest or demonstration and is blocking traffic in a public right-of-way shall be immune from civil liability for such injury.

595.title: Automated Traffic Violation Monitoring Systems
595.description: Increases the amount of time, from fourteen (14) days to twenty-eight (28) days, for a summons to issue solely based on evidence obtained by use of an automated traffic-violation-detection system.

596.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
596.title: Condominium Law--creation, Alteration, And Termination Of Condominiums
596.description: Increases the percentage of unit owners needed to consent to the termination of a condominium from eighty percent (80%) to ninety percent (90%).

597.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
597.title: Form And Effect Of Conveyances
597.description: Validates certain conveyancing defects in various instruments executed by or affecting grantors, grantees, business entities, powers of attorney, probate fiduciaries, mortgage discharges and foreclosures or certain clerical defects.

598.title: Fraud And False Dealing
598.description: Criminalizes residential mortgage fraud and extend the statute of limitations for certain offenses regarding financial and banking fraud.

600.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
600.title: Rhode Island Fair Housing Practices
600.description: Clarifies that "housing status" is a protected class under the Rhode Island Fair Housing Practices Act.

601.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
601.title: Election Offenses
601.description: Eliminates the requirement of identifying the name or names of the author of a circular, flier, or poster designed to injure or defeat any candidate for election to public office.

602.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
602.description: Requires at least one precinct count unit in each town.

604.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting, Equipment And Supplies
604.description: Gives local boards discretion to designate times and places where optical scan voting equipment and sample ballots are exhibited for instructional purposes.

607.title: Post-election Audits
607.description: Authorizes the board of elections to establish a post-election risk-limiting audit program to improve the accuracy of election results.

608.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
608.title: Mail Ballots - Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
608.description: Requires any person voting by mail or emergency ballot to provide proof of identity.

609.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
609.title: Fail Safe Voting Provisions
609.description: Permits a voter who has moved from one city or town in the state to another thirty (30) days or more prior to an election to vote a full ballot in the new city or town.

610.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
610.title: Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting
610.description: Eliminates the reporting requirements imposed on campaign treasurers for expenditures made concerning a candidate by persons/groups not acting in concert with the candidate's campaign in light of the existing reporting requirements contained in 17-25.3-1.

611.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
611.title: Campaign Finance Compliance
611.description: Prohibits any person who owes more than five hundred dollars ($500) in board of election imposed fines, fees and penalties for more than two (2) years, and who has exhausted all of their appeals, to run for public office.

612.title: Campaign Finance
612.description: Provides additional guidance concerning the proposed disposition of remaining campaign funds of a deceased candidate or officeholder, former candidate or former officeholder.

614.title: Courts
614.description: Authorizes magistrates to preside over additional matters that are heard before the family court.

615.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
615.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Contribution Among Joint Tortfeasors
615.description: Original tortfeasor is liable for a injuries victim suffers due to negligent third-party treatment.

616.title: Procedure In Particular Actions
616.description: Provides that those seeking review of a post-conviction relief final judgment must file their petition for writ of certiorari within sixty days from the date of final judgment.

617.title: Uniform Interstate Family Support Act -- General Provisions
617.description: Makes a technical correction to the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act.

618.title: Courts -- Court Administration
618.description: Limits the judiciary's publicly available list of delinquent persons to the 100 delinquent persons owing the largest amount of court imposed or court related fees, and other monetary obligations which have been unpaid for a period in excess of 90 days.

619.title: Superior Court
619.description: Allows those individuals with prior convictions for possession with intent to deliver or crimes of violence, to be eligible for the drug court program in Superior Court.

620.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
620.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Contributions Among Joint Tortfeasors
620.description: Requires that a tortfeasor's share of a judgment be borne by all parties to the action in accordance with their pro rata share of culpability whenever a tortfeasor is found to be unable to satisfy their share.

622.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
622.title: Provision Of Volunteer Health Care Services
622.description: Grants immunity from liability and suit to health care professionals, workers, and facilities providing volunteer services, and would also provide continuing education credits for such services.

624.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
624.title: Hotels
624.description: Authorizes an innkeeper to remove any guest who is a level III high risk sexual offender who attempts to remain a hotel resident for more than thirty (30) consecutive days in any calendar year.

627.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
627.title: Sexual Assault
627.description: Amends the definition of "sexual contact" for the purposes of criminal offenses to include the intentional touching of the victim's own intimate parts at the accused's instruction.

637.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
637.title: Peace Officers
637.description: Designates certain program workers and shift coordinators at the training school as peace officers while on duty.

642.title: In Amendment Of The Incorporation Of The Central Coventry Fire District In Furtherance Of The "consolidation Plan" Of The Central Coventry Fire District, The Washington Lighting District, The Harris Fire And Lighting District And The Tiogue Fire District As Approved By The Qualified Voters Of Said Districts, At Duly Called Meetings Held On March 28, 2006
642.description: Amends and make a number of changes to the legislative charter of Central Coventry Fire District.

644.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
644.title: Public Assistance Act
644.description: Prohibits the use of electronic-benefit-transfer (EBT) cards at retail establishments unless the recipient presents a valid photo identification card.

648.title: Retirement System--contributions And Benefits
648.description: Prevents reduction of the yearly state contribution to the pension system until the fund ratio exceeds eighty percent (80%).

649.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
649.title: Adjustment Of Disability Pensions
649.description: Requires municipal/quasi-municipal entities to annually adjust disability pensions according to any compensation earned.

650.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
650.title: Education Assistance And Development Tax Credit
650.description: Creates a tax credit for any and all gifts, grants, and donations to public schools.

651.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
651.title: Relating To Education-foundation Level School Support
651.description: Amends the maintenance of effort provisions used to determine the minimum contribution for local school aid.

652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
652.title: The Rhode Island Student Loan Authority
652.description: Establishes a 2% reduction in student loan interest program to be administered by the student loan authority for college graduates who live and work in Rhode Island for a period of at least 2 years.

654.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
654.title: Residence Of Children For School Purposes
654.description: Requires the department of education and the DCYF to develop a procedure to ensure that the municipalities where group homes or other residential facilities are located are reimbursed for the educational expenses above the cost allocated.

657.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
657.title: Real Estate Conveyance Tax
657.description: Exempts from the real estate conveyance tax the transfer of interests in any housing development financed in whole or in part by federal low income housing tax credits.

659.title: Courtesy Plates
659.description: Removes the service charge of sixty dollars ($60.00) on automobile vanity plate renewals and substitute a one-time fee of two hundred dollars ($200).

660.title: Definitions And General Code Provisions - Antique Motor Cars
660.description: Permits an antique motor car to be issued a courtesy plate.

662.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
662.title: Registration Fees--disabled Veterans
662.description: Expands and clarifies what constitutes disability entitling disabled veterans to the waiver of motor vehicle registration fees.

663.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
663.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
663.description: Adds campus police officers to the group of public safety officials eligible to collect salary, wages, benefits during periods of whole/partial incapacitation incurred while on-duty or while providing emergency assistance within the state while off-duty.

664.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
664.title: Emergency Management Director Emeritus
664.description: Creates an emergency management director emeritus license plate for Thomas F. Senerchia of West Warwick.

665.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
665.title: Registration Fees
665.description: Requires the owners of antique motor vehicles to register them at a fee based upon the vehicle's weight.

666.title: Gold Star Families
666.description: Creates and expands eligibility for a special license plate for Gold Star Families.

667.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
667.title: Break-down Lane Use
667.description: Authorizes the state traffic commission to permit the use of break-down lanes for travel and erects signs indicating when and where travel is permitted.

670.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
670.title: Sales And Use Taxes--enforcement And Collection
670.description: Provides that any person who has a retail sales permit would not be required to pay a separate registration fee to make sales at flea markets; however, the person remains responsible to pay all taxes due as a result of sales at a flea market.

673.title: Rhode Island Promise Scholarship
673.description: Establishes a post-secondary education scholarship program to be funded in part by the state and in partnership with public and private entities that engage in a memorandum of understanding that internships would be provided.

674.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
674.title: Convention Center Authority
674.description: Requires the Convention Center Authority Corporation to use fifty percent (50%) of any net profit identified by an annual accounting approved by the corporation to reduce any existing corporate debt.

676.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
676.title: Public Finance Management
676.description: Waives any fees on debt issues, bonds, or notes of or purchased by the Rhode Island health educational building corporation (RIHEBC) relating to the "school building authority capital fund" or "foundation level support".

677.title: Motion Picture Production Tax Credits
677.description: Removes video games from the definition of "motion picture" for the purposes of the Motion Picture Credit Tax Act, extending from 7/1/2021, to 7/1/2024.

678.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
678.title: Rhode Island Livable Home Tax Credit Act
678.description: Establishes the "Rhode Island Livable Home Tax Credit Act", and would provide for its administration.

682.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
682.title: Roads And Bridges Funding
682.description: Creates a trust fund, funded by road and bridge tolls, the gasoline tax and fees generated by the division of motor vehicles to pay for the maintenance and construction of state roads and bridges.

685.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
685.title: Excise Tax On Motor Vehicles And Trailers
685.description: Repeals the excise tax on motor vehicles and replace it with user and product landing fees to be administered by the department of revenue.

687.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
687.title: Sugary Drinks
687.description: Creates a tax on sugary drinks for the purpose of reducing the demand for those beverages, and discouraging the excessive consumption of, sugary drinks.

688.title: Offer In Compromise Of Personal Income Tax Debt Act
688.description: Establishes a personal income tax debt resolution process within the division of taxation upon submission of an offer in compromise effective July 1, 2018.

693.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
693.title: Relating To Sports, Racing And Athletics
693.description: Authorizes the division of racing and athletics to implement online games of skill, including so-called fantasy sports.

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Rhode Island
694.description: Authorizes the state lottery commission to establish an instant game entitled Rhode Island Museum’s Blackjack, the net revenues of which would be used to maintain and support nonprofit museums located in the state.

695.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
695.title: Medical Assistance--long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
695.description: Provides for a Medicaid home care base rate adjustment in parity with Medicaid base rates in neighboring states and helps Medicaid-contracted home care providers compete with neighboring states in hiring and retaining direct care workers.

698.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
698.title: Indebtedness Of Towns And Cities--study Of Consolidation
698.description: Directs the department of administration to study using the bonding authority of the state to consolidate the bonded indebtedness of the towns and cities.

699.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
