699.title: Economic Development Assistance
699.description: Prohibits any state economic assistance from the commerce corporation to a business entity for a move within the state.

700.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
700.title: Relating To The State-operated Gaming Facilities In Lincoln, Newport, And, When Operations Commence, In Tiverton
700.description: Allows the state to take certain actions in regard to state gaming as a result the recent referendum authorizing the establishment of a new casino gaming facility in the town of Tiverton.

701.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
701.title: The Product Stewardship Bottle Recycling Act
701.description: Creates a beverage container program using redemption centers which would include the use of automated devices to accept containers for recycling.

702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
702.title: State Construction Projects Metrics
702.description: Requires that the division of planning create a checklist of environmental and energy issues that certain state construction projects which cost in excess of ten million dollars ($10,000,000) would need to consider and address.

704.title: Rhode Island Retirement Security Program
704.description: Establishes the Rhode Island retirement security program for the purpose of making retirement plans available to employees not otherwise available to them, and to promote and enhance retirement savings for private sector employees in the state.

706.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
706.title: Relating To Military Affairs And Defense
706.description: Has the veterans' cemetery bear the cost of funeral processions from Aquidneck Island crossing the Newport Bridge.

707.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
707.title: The Young Adult Voluntary Extension Of Care Act
707.description: Creates the young adult voluntary extension of care program that would extend the age of foster care from age eighteen (18) to age twenty-one (21) and would provide a range of programs and services to carry out the purpose of the act.

708.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
708.title: The Climate Change Coastal Adaptation Trust Fund
708.description: Establishes the RI coastal adaptation trust fund which would enable cities and towns and the state to apply for grants to fund projects that invest in measures that adapt infrastructure on public lands to address the impacts of climate change.

709.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
709.title: Breast-feeding
709.description: Creates an enforcement process for the right to breast-feed at work. In addition, it would require all schools to provide reasonable accommodation to its lactating students.

710.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
710.title: Air Pollution
710.description: Regulates the phase-out of wood stoves without EPA certification in densely populated residential areas and requires material burned in wood stoves to be clean wood or other approved material.

711.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Jamestown
711.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Jamestown, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Jamestown on November 8, 2016.

712.title: Award Of Municipal Contracts
712.description: Adds certain federal requirements to the selection of architects and engineers and permits prequalification of architects and engineers by cities and towns.

713.title: The Rhode Island Patient Safety Act Of 2008
713.description: Amends the definition of "Patient safety work product" to conform with the federal "Patient Safety and Quality Improvement Act of 2005".

716.last_action: Senate voted to recommit to Senate Health and Human Services
716.title: Public Health And Workplace Safety Act
716.description: Amends the definitions of "smoking" and "retail tobacco store" to include electronic smoking devices, electronic nicotine delivery system products and other products that rely on vaporization or aerosolization.

717.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
717.title: Formaldehyde Control
717.description: Prohibits the use of formaldehyde or formaldehyde replacements in certain children's products.

718.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
718.title: Prohibition Of Containers Using Bisphenol A
718.description: Prohibits the use of containers, or food packaged in containers that contain bisphenol A.

719.title: Departments Of State Government
719.description: Requires that an information technology project manager be assigned for all requests for proposals for information technology projects.

720.last_action: House passed Sub B in concurrence
720.title: Liability Insurance
720.description: Insurance coverage for rental motor vehicles without regard to negligence, would include loss of use.

725.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
725.title: Spousal Notice For Abortion
725.description: Repeals the requirement of notice to husband of a patient before an abortion procedure.

728.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
728.title: Tax Incentives For Employers
728.description: Repeals the section of the law requiring all corporations doing business in the state of Rhode Island to add back into their taxable income any amount deducted under the federal "Domestic Production Deduction" of the Internal Revenue Code 26 U.S.C. §199.

729.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
729.title: State Lottery
729.description: Creates an instant ticket scratch off game pilot program to raise funds for Rhode Island veterans and dependents of qualified service members.

730.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
730.title: Relating To The Medicaid Reform Act Of 2008
730.description: Authorizes the secretary of health and human services to implement changes under the Rhode Island Medicaid reform act.

731.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
731.title: Public Electric Vehicle Charging Stations Tax Credit
731.description: Allows a tax credit of thirty percent (30%) of the construction cost of an electric fueled vehicle charging station to a maximum of thirty thousand dollars ($30,000).

732.title: Rhode Island Public Transit Authority
732.description: Authorizes RIPTA to provide an open-door service to all passengers to and from Rhode Island to locations within five (5) miles of the Rhode Island boarder into Massachusetts and Connecticut.

734.title: Licensing
734.description: Allows physician practices to maintain their license standards, even if a hospital system owns the practice.

735.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
735.title: Medical Assistance And Public Assistance Caseload Estimating Conferences
735.description: Requires the participation and input of the EOHHS, DHS, DCYF and BDHDDH in medical assistance and public assistance caseload estimating conferences and the generation of monthly data to the members of the caseload estimating conference.

736.title: Municipal Road And Bridge Revolving Fund
736.description: Amends several sections relative to the eligibility and award process for projects that receive financial assistance from PACE (Property Assessment Clean Energy) programs and the Rhode Island infrastructure bank.

737.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
737.title: Health Care For Elderly And Disabled
737.description: Increases the income eligibility limit for medical assistance coverage for seniors and disabled individuals to one hundred thirty-three percent (133%) of federal poverty level.

739.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
739.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act - School Funding Formula
739.description: Freezes the amount of education aid for local school agencies that are scheduled to receive less aid under the funding formula. The education aid would be frozen at the rate provided in fiscal year 2017 for a period of three (3) years.

740.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
740.title: Payment Of Wages
740.description: Establishes a procedure for employees to secure liens against employers for unpaid wages. Contested claims would be decided by superior court. Contracts of employment in contravention of provisions of this procedure would be void as against public policy.

741.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
741.title: Powers And Duties Of Fire Districts In The Town Of Coventry
741.description: Repeals the section of the general laws which provides for an automatic appropriation for Coventry Fire Districts which fail to approve an annual appropriation.

742.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
742.title: Mobile And Manufactured Homes--affordable Housing
742.description: Qualifies mobile and manufactured homes as affordable housing when installed in mobile home parks in groups of twenty (20) or more.

744.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
744.title: Building On Or Development Of State Land
744.description: Requires general assembly approval for construction on or development of certain classes of state-owned properties.

745.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
745.title: Eminent Domain
745.description: Requires approval by the general assembly to implement eminent domain proceedings for certain types of proposed development plans.

747.title: Assaults
747.description: Makes assault and battery upon delivery persons a felony and mandates a maximum sentence of imprisonment of 3 years. Persons convicted of such an assault and battery while using a dangerous weapon, the minimum sentence is imprisonment for 5 years.

748.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--procedure Generally
748.description: Adds the Rhode Island traffic tribunal to the list of courts afforded the ability to dismiss cases for lack of prosecution.

750.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
750.title: Delinquent And Dependent Children-- Criminal Injuries Compensation-- Sexually Exploited Children
750.description: Makes sex trafficking victims eligible for criminal injuries compensation fund and designates them as abused, neglected children and establishes "safe harbor" provisions.

751.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
751.title: Healthy Workplace
751.description: Creates the "Healthy Workplace Act of 2017" and establishes a cause of action against employers and employees for workplace bullying, harassment and other abusive conduct that is tolerated by employers.

753.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
753.title: Litigation Lending Agreements
753.description: Makes litigation loan agreements subject to state usury statutes.

754.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
754.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
754.description: Increased the number of permits for medical marijuana compassion centers from three (3) to six (6).

755.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
755.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-weapons
755.description: Makes alteration of firearm identification marks punishable by not less than two (2) years imprisonment and by no more than five (5) years imprisonment.

757.title: The Kent County Water District
757.description: Adds two (2) members to the board of the Kent County Water Authority.

760.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
760.title: Public Utility Commission
760.description: Exempts from definition of public utility public entities that sell water outside their territorial limits to no more than 5 outside customers, 2% or less of total sales and charge outside customers a price no greater than inside customers.

761.title: Energy Facility Siting Act
761.description: Prevents the energy facility siting board from proceeding to final hearing or issuing a final decision if one or more of the designated agencies inform the siting board that they are unable to form an advisory opinion due the conduct of the applicant.

762.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
762.title: Interlocal Contracting And Joint Enterprises, And Regional Emergency Communication Districts
762.description: Authorizes two or more municipalities to form regional emergency communication districts.

763.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
763.title: Woonsocket Municipal Housing Court
763.description: Authorizes the city of Woonsocket to establish a municipal housing court to consider potential violations of city zoning ordinances and applicable state laws and code provisions.

767.title: Firefighter Disability
767.description: Creates a work disabling presumption for any firefighter who passed a physical examination upon entry into service and who later contracts disabling hypertension, stroke, or heart disease.

775.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
775.title: E-911 Uniform Emergency Telephone System Division
775.description: Requires all the money collected for various billed services, by each telecommunications provider be deposited in a restricted receipt account, not the general fund.

777.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
777.title: Rhode Island Municipal Infrastructure Grant Program
777.description: Creates a municipal infrastructure grant program within the DOA relating to municipal and other public infrastructure projects.

778.title: Temporary Disability Insurance
778.description: Expands TDI benefits, change the calculation of the taxable wage base increases the maximum number of weeks an employee can collect TDI and TCI, and expands TCI benefits for the care of siblings and grandchildren.

780.title: Unfair Competition And Practices
780.description: Requires all valid auto body labor rate surveys to be signed by an authorized representative executed under penalty of perjury.

782.title: Regulation Of Business Practices Among Motor Vehicle Manufacturers, Distributors, And Dealers
782.description: Establishes standardized methods and appeals procedures for the calculation of fair and reasonable compensation for parts and labor used in warranty services.

783.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
783.title: Department Of Business Regulation--automobile Wrecking And Salvage Yards
783.description: Prohibits any entity or individual from advertising the sale, purchase, receipt, transport, delivery or salvage of any auto wrecking or discarded automobile unless the advertiser is a licensed junk or salvage yard.

784.title: Visitation Rights
784.description: Establishes guidelines for the family court to use to decide petitions for visitation by grandparents based on a best interest of the grandchild standard.

785.title: Relating To The Cumberland Fire District
785.description: Establishes that membership on the Cumberland Fire District Fire Committee constitutes holding a public office and that the elections of the Fire Committee are governed by state election laws.

786.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
786.title: Rhode Island Food, Drugs, And Cosmetics Act
786.description: Requires manufacturers to fully disclose to the DOH all ingredients contained in their cosmetic products manufactured, distributed or sold in the state, and further subjects a manufacturer to financial penalties for a violation of this requirement.

788.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
788.title: Lead Poisoning Prevention Act
788.description: Promotes safe drinking water at school and early childhood programs by implementing procedures to reduce and eliminate lead in water.

789.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
789.title: Relating To Corporations, Associations, And Partnerships
789.description: Imposes a fee of one hundred sixty dollars ($160) for all domestic and foreign corporations for a certificate of authority to transact business in this state.

791.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
791.title: Statewide Site Readiness Fund
791.description: Creates the statewide site readiness fund a state sponsored fund for the preparation of shared ready commercial, industrial and manufacturing property in the state.

793.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
793.title: Payment Of Statutory Fees
793.description: Authorizes state departments and agencies to allow a vendor to withhold a commission for developing and implementing a web-based system for filing of applications for licenses and permits.

794.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
794.title: Taxation Of Beverages
794.description: Exempts from the alcoholic beverage manufacturing tax the first fifty thousand (50,000) gallons of wine produced by a winery in this state for distribution in RI in any calendar year.

796.title: Relating To The City Of Woonsocket Validating Certain Amendments To The City Of Woonsocket, Rhode Island Code Of Ordinances
796.description: Ratifies certain amendments made to the Woonsocket Code of Ordinances by the city council of the city of Woonsocket on or about August 30, 2016.

797.title: Hawkers And Peddlers
797.description: Gives the city of Woonsocket the power to license and regulate peddlers selling or offering flowers.

799.title: Disclosure By The State Investment Commissions Of Performance And Expenses Of Retirement System Investment Managers
799.description: Requires the general treasurer to maintain its transparent treasury initiative to assist the public in accessing information regarding how state pension investments are managed and performing.

802.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
802.title: Police-worn Body Cameras
802.description: Mandates protocols for the use of police-worn body cameras by those law enforcement agencies which choose to require their use.

803.title: Domestic Abuse Prevention
803.description: Amends the definition of "domestic abuse" to include acts by a person who knowingly/willfully encourages/aids/coerces any minor child to engage in commercial sex acts and allows a parent or legal custodian to seek a protective order on behalf of a minor.

804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
804.title: Property -- Eminent Domain
804.description: Permits the prior owner of a parcel of land taken by eminent domain, but unused for the purpose intended, to repurchase at the acquisition price.

805.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
805.title: Birth Certificates
805.description: Permits a parenting partner of a mother, with the mother's consent, to be included on a birth certificate as a parent to the child.

809.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
809.title: Wrongful Discharge From Employment
809.description: Ends Rhode Island's adoption of the "employment-at-will" legal doctrine and would provide some job protection for employees that satisfactorily perform their duties. The act would also provide specific remedies for wrongful discharge.

811.title: Nursing Facilities Bed Capacity Moratorium
811.description: Establishes limited conditions that must be satisfied to permit an increase in the bed capacity of existing nursing facilities, despite the moratorium on expansion.

813.title: Foreign Insurance Companies
813.description: Eliminates continuing education board (CEB) service of process by certified mail and prohibits claim negotiation with unlicensed public adjusters from excluding coverage to volunteer drivers.

814.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
814.title: Hearing Aids
814.description: Increases the insurance coverage for hearing aids from $1,500 to $2,000, per ear, every three years. In addition the amount of insurance coverage would no longer be based on the age of the recipient.

818.title: Campaign Contributions
818.description: Defines the terms "conduit" and "earmarked" for purposes of reporting campaign contributions and eliminates the aggregate contribution limits and adds a prohibition of earmarked funds.

820.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
820.title: Public Use Of Private Lands--liability Limitations
820.description: Excludes the state and municipalities from the definition of "owner" for the purposes of liability limitations relating to public use of private lands.

821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
821.title: North Kingstown Municipal Court
821.description: Allows the North Kingstown Municipal Court to issue arrest warrants.

824.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
824.title: Joint Committee On Naming New Buildings
824.description: Names the traffic tribunal "The Albert E. DeRobbio Traffic Tribunal."

825.title: Protection Of Information Systems Act
825.description: Requires all state, municipal and quasi-public departments to protect information contained in their computer systems by complying with the criteria set forth in the US Department of Commerce’s (NIST) publication (800-171).

827.title: Veteran's Exemption - Jamestown
827.description: Permits the town of Jamestown to provide a tax exemption for veterans and a tax credit for one hundred percent (100%) for disabled veterans.

828.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
828.title: Relating To Alcoholic Beverages-retail Licenses
828.description: Permits retail Class A alcohol license holders, wholesalers, and suppliers to provide liquor, malt beverages, wine and other alcoholic beverages at tastings to be conducted on premises.

829.title: Enabling The Town Council Of The Town Of Burrillville To Exempt Certain Property From Taxation
829.description: Reduces to three (3) years the residency requirement for the town of Burrillville's partial real estate tax exemption for the elderly.

830.title: In Amendment To Entitled "to Incorporate The West Glocester Fire District"
830.description: Amends the charter of the West Glocester Fire District.

833.title: General Powers -- Warren Municipal Housing Court
833.description: Authorizes the town council of the town of Warren to create a municipal housing court and defines that court's jurisdiction.

834.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
834.title: Tabulation And Certification Of Returns By State Board
834.description: Requires the board of elections to report all votes received by write-in candidates.

835.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
835.title: Electronic Vehicle Recovery Services
835.description: Creates the "Electronic Vehicle Recovery Services Act" to require vehicle owners with electronic recovery systems to submit an affidavit attesting to the theft of their motor vehicle prior to law enforcement contacting the recovery service provider.

836.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
836.title: Health Care Facilities Staffing
836.description: Broadens definition of "employee" to include assistants/technologists providing direct medical care to patients and allows union/association to file appeal to personnel appeal board.

837.title: Firefighters' Arbitration
837.description: Allows unionized firefighters to enter into an agreement which continues all contractual provisions contained in an expiring contract until a successor agreement has been reached.

838.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
838.title: Authorizing The North Kingstown School Committee To Develop A Policy On Early Entry To Kindergarten
838.description: Allows the North Kingstown school committee to develop a policy allowing for early entry to kindergarten.

839.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act -- Electronic Prescription Of Controlled Substances
839.description: Expands the type of pharmaceuticals which may be prescribed using electronic prescriptions and would also provide for protection of patient privacy in regard to electronic prescriptions.

840.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
840.title: Establishment Of Charter Public Schools
840.description: Establishes district-charter compacts between charter schools and traditional public schools and would establish a compact fund to be supported by appropriations from the general assembly as well as grants, gifts and bequests.

841.title: Burrillville Property Tax
841.description: Further delineates the ability of the town of Burrillville to tax electrical power generation facilities, regulated or otherwise and for private consumption on resale.

842.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (06/08/2017)
842.title: Railroad Preservation
842.description: Suspends any payments due to MBTA or its operating subcontractor for so long as either is in default on the South County operating agreement.

843.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
843.title: Rhode Island Sales And Use Tax Reimbursement Act
843.description: Provides that in the event sales and use tax revenue exceeds projections, then in such event the tax administrator would reduce the sales tax rate by one percent (1%) until the end of the fiscal year.

844.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
844.title: Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
844.description: Provides that the state would pay the local share or contribution of charter public school tuition for the number of students attending the charter public schools in excess of five percent (5%) of the average daily membership of all pupils.

847.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
847.title: Relating To Towns And Cities
847.description: Provides that municipal insurance corporations be subject to laws regulating insurance companies and be regulated by the Rhode Island department of business regulation.

848.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
848.title: Joint Committee On Regulatory Oversight
848.description: Eliminates previous sections of the general laws and require that all proposed rules and regulations promulgated by state entities be submitted to and approved by the joint committee on regulatory oversight before becoming effective.

850.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
850.title: Adjudication Of Traffic Offenses
850.description: Mandates that any traffic offense in the Rhode Island traffic tribunal or any municipal court, that is dismissed shall be expunged and deleted from court records within 48 hours.

851.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
851.title: Access To Public Records -- Cost
851.description: Provides that fees for costs charged for search, retrieval or copies of public records shall be waived for a member of the general assembly who certifies that they are acting in their official capacity.

852.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
852.title: Surveillance Devices
852.description: Prohibits surveillance on any public roadway in the state unless specifically authorized by statute or court order and provides for the confidentiality of information collected or stored.

853.title: Relating To Domestic Relations
853.description: Adds the definition of "sexual exploitation" in the domestic abuse prevention law to include acts by any person who knowingly or willfully encourages, aids or coerces any child under the age of eighteen (18) years to engage in commercial sex acts.

854.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
854.title: The Towing Storage Act
854.description: Requires that motor vehicles lawfully seized by police officers for investigation or for lack of registration not be released to their owners until the towing charges are paid and valid registration certificates are produced.

856.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
856.title: State Investment Commission
856.description: Requires investment commission to include separate section in annual report providing information and supporting documents relating to alternative investment consultant(s), hiring, performance, and confidentiality agreements.

857.title: Certification Of Teachers
857.description: Waives the fee for taking an examination required in order to be licensed and certified as a teacher when the teaching candidate possesses a bachelor's degree.

858.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
858.title: Rhode Island Tax Increment Financing
858.description: Allows infrastructure of a political subdivision to qualify for tax increment financing agreements.

859.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
859.title: Penalties For Environmental Violations
859.description: Adopts a penalty of twelve percent (12%) per annum on administrative penalties that are in default.

860.title: Credit Unions
860.description: Transfers the expulsion power of members to credit union management from the board of directors, provides written notice to the member of expulsion, and establishes a ten (10) business day appeal procedure to the board of directors.

861.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
861.title: Workers' Cooperatives
861.description: Creates a statutory vehicle for the creation and functioning of workers' cooperatives which are corporations that are owned and democratically governed by their members.

862.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rubalcook, Inc.
862.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rubalcook, Inc.

863.title: Correctional Officers' Arbitration
863.description: Allows the bargaining agent for the correctional officers and the state authority to extend, by agreement in writing, the thirty (30) day period to reach an agreement on a contract, before submitting unresolved issues to arbitration.

865.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
865.title: Low Speed Vehicles
865.description: Permits the operation of low speed vehicles on certain Rhode Island roads under specific conditions.

866.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
866.title: Reporting Political Contributions By State Vendors
866.description: Extend the limitation on political contributions for state or municipal vendors and establishes significant penalties for violations.

867.title: Primary Elections
867.description: Allows a person appointed as a primary official to be an employee of the United States, of this state, or of any city or town of this state.

869.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
869.title: Crimes Against The Public Trust
869.description: Creates the crimes against public trust act to punish crimes committed by public officers, provide restitution for the crimes, and extend the statute of limitations for wrongful conversion.

873.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
873.title: Rhode Island Values Act--enhanced Community Protection In Immigration Enforcement Action
873.description: Prohibits federal immigration authorities from access to certain identified sensitive locations, except unless very limited circumstances.

874.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
874.title: Snow Removal Service Liability Limitation Act
874.description: Defines snow removal contracts between service providers and service receivers and limit liability between them and declare indemnity agreements void as against public policy.

877.title: Division Of Developmental Disabilities
877.description: Requires that "individualized program plan" (IPP) include evaluation of individuals strengths, difficulties, needs and goals by independent third party at the sole expense of the division of developmental disabilities.

878.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
878.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes -- Liability And Computation -- Enforcement And Collection
878.description: Repeals the estate and transfer taxes and takes effect on July 1, 2017 and applies to estates of decedents whose death occurs on or after July 1, 2017.

879.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
879.title: Retirement Of Municipal Employees And Closed Municipal Retirement Plans
879.description: Makes it easier for locally administered municipal retirement plans to join the municipal employees' retirement system, by providing greater flexibility in funding policies than would otherwise be required.

880.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
880.title: Tax Credits For Contributions To Scholarship Organizations
880.description: Increases the total aggregate amount of tax credits for a business entity not to exceed $5,000,000 in fiscal year 2018.

882.title: Rhode Island Health Benefit Exchange
882.description: Authorize the RI health benefit exchange to seek a waiver under the Affordable Care Act to allow qualified small business owners/sole proprietors to purchase qualified health benefit plans offered by the exchange directly from a registered carrier.

883.title: Department Of Environmental Management - Pets
883.description: Allows psittacine birds (parrots and parakeets) to accompany their owners at state-owned campgrounds, subject to the restrictions enumerated.

885.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
885.title: Write-in Candidates
885.description: Requires candidates seeking to be elected by write-in ballots to file a declaration of intent.

890.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
890.title: Child Care - State Subsidies
890.description: Establishes a tiered-rate structure for the child care assistance program, with higher rates paid to licensed child care centers and family child care homes that have achieved higher quality ratings in "BrightStars".

892.title: Regulation Of Sales
892.description: Exempts persons over 59 yrs of age and those who cannot operate a motor vehicle because of a disability from being charged a fee for an ID card from the DMV provided they have no valid operator's license or are surrendering one due to inability to drive.

896.title: The Permanent Air Quality Monitoring Act
896.description: Reduces the items which must be monitored by the air-quality monitors at T.F. Green Airport to particles less than 0.1 microns, and black carbon.

897.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
897.title: The Student Loan Bill Of Rights
897.description: Authorizes the creation of the Student Loan Ombudsman within the Department of Business Regulation. The Ombudsman's duties would be to assist student loan borrowers with issues pertaining to their loans.

898.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
898.title: Commercial Real Estate Broker Lien
898.description: Provides that failure to record a notice of lien by the real estate broker in accordance with chapter 49 of title 34, the commercial estate broker lien act, would result in dismissal of a complaint pursuant to the act.

901.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
901.title: Rhode Island Uniform Commercial Driver's License Act
901.description: Prohibits the state from suspending or otherwise disqualifying a person from the privilege of maintaining a commercial driver license based on certain traffic violations arising from the operation of a non-commercial vehicle.

902.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance
902.description: Designates October 23 of each year as a day to commemorate the nine Rhode Island marines killed in the 1983 terrorist attack in Beirut, Lebanon.

903.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
903.title: Farm Conservation And Renewable Energy
903.description: Provides for the siting and operating standards for farm-based renewable energy facilities.

909.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
909.title: Size, Weight And Load Limits--middletown
909.description: Imposes size and weight restrictions on through traffic on Forest Avenue, Middletown.

910.title: Veterans' Exemptions--scituate
910.description: Permits the town of Scituate to provide a tax credit to disabled veterans in lieu of a tax exemption.

912.title: Municipal Retirement--retirement System Membership
912.description: Places the current Cranston police chief in a defined contribution retirement plan.

913.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
913.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers-the Energy And Consumer Savings Act Of 2005
913.description: Establishes minimum energy efficiency standards for certain products sold or installed in the state.

918.title: Emergency Police Power
918.description: Amends the provisions regarding emergency police powers to clarify that higher learning institutions with special police officers are authorized to enter into mutual aid agreements for the purpose of providing emergency assistance.

920.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
920.title: Relating To Commercial Law--general Regulatory Provisions
920.description: Prevents any state or municipal agency's telecommunications or Internet contractor from collecting and disseminating the personal information of customers.

921.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
921.title: Right-to-know Act
921.description: Protects individuals from Internet disclosure of personally identifiable information by commercial websites/online service operators and creates right of action for violations.

922.title: Children With Disabilities
922.description: Benefits for students with disabilities continue until the end of the public school calendar semester when the student turns 21 or when the student’s program ends in accordance with the student’s (IEP), whichever occurs earlier.

923.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
923.title: Mayoral Academies
923.description: Requires any mayoral academy which is part of a network that seeks to be established or expanded to provide evidence that its attrition rates, special education rates and suspension rates are within acceptable averages.

924.title: City Of Pawtucket -- Neil J. Houston, Jr. Residential Re-entry Center
924.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to exempt from taxation the real and personal property of the Neil J. Houston, Jr. Community Resources for Justice Center.

925.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
925.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions-engineers
925.description: Creates a professional designation and registration criteria for professional software engineers.

926.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Coventry
926.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Coventry, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Coventry on November 8, 2016.

927.title: Taxation Of Farm, Forest, And Open Space Land
927.description: Exempts land previously classified as farm, forest or open space land from land use change tax if the landowner converts no more than twenty percent (20%) acreage to install a renewable energy system.

930.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The City Of Woonsocket
930.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the city of Woonsocket, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the city of Woonsocket on November 8, 2016.

931.title: Block Island Utility District Act Of 2017
931.description: Creates the Block Island utility district to provide utility products and services to the town of New Shoreham.

932.title: Electronic Recording
932.description: Authorizes a city or town clerk/recorder of deeds, at the clerk's/recorder's option, to accept electronic documents for recording real property and land records and to index and store those documents.

934.title: Frozen Desserts
934.description: Eliminates multiple fees for frozen dessert processors licensed as food service establishments.

937.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
937.title: Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction And Maintenance Fund--tolls
937.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws which created the "Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction, and Maintenance Fund Act of 2016" ("Rhode Works"), which would have imposed tolls on large commercial trucks.

938.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
938.title: Notaries Public And Justices Of The Peace
938.description: Establishes a new application and certification process for notarial officers.

939.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
939.title: Unlawful Employment Practices
939.description: Prohibits an employer from inquiring about a prospective employee wage and salary history before an offer of employment with compensation has been negotiated.

940.title: Electronic Waste Prevention, Reuse And Recycling Act
940.description: Amends the electronic waste preventions, reuse and recycling act.

941.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
941.title: Subdivision Regulations
941.description: Permits the substitution by a developer of sprinklers in new developments instead of cisterns or water reservoirs for fire suppression, if allowed by ordinance.

943.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
943.title: Nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates; Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting; Criminal Offenses --theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses, And Misappropriations
943.description: Increases fines/penalties for failure to file timely campaign finance reports; increases information required in a declaration of candidacy; requires random audits of finance reports; and authorizes forfeiture of campaign funds for conviction of crimes.

944.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
944.title: Department Of Administration
944.description: Prohibits state guide plan from requiring any city or town from adopting a housing ordinance that exceeds laws of Rhode Island or city or town's zoning laws.

945.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
945.title: Pathway To Retirement Security Act For Locally Administered Pension Funds
945.description: Provides that municipal pension funds only be diverted to the state upon approval of the applicable decision-making body after a public hearing, and a minimum of thirty (30) days prior written notice to affected employees.

947.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
947.title: The Rhode Island Cooperative Water Authority
947.description: Establishes the Rhode Island cooperative water authority. The authority would have the power to acquire, lease, manage, sell, and otherwise deal with land and water supply systems and authorized to issue bonds and notes in furtherance of its mission.

948.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
948.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Uniform Fraudulent Transfer Act
948.description: Amends the "Uniform Fraudulent Transfer Act" to be called the "Uniform Voidable Transactions Act" and amends several provisions to the general laws to reflect this change.

951.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
951.title: Tourism And Development
951.description: Extends from June 30, 2017 to June 30, 2018, the formula for the distribution of the proceeds of the hotel tax in accordance with the percentages for returns and tax payments received on or before December 31, 2015.

952.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
952.title: Commerce Corporation
952.description: Prohibits the commerce corporation, without general assembly approval or resolution, from providing leases, loan guarantees, grants or any other financial assistance, for any baseball park, recreational facility or any ancillary facility development.

955.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
955.title: Funding Of Charter Public Schools
955.description: Have local district payments to charter public schools made only for those periods during which a student is enrolled and attending the charter school.

956.title: Relating To Education
956.description: Allows school committees and the Rhode Island Society of Technology Educators ("RISTE") to enter into joint purchase agreements for the purchase of technology and IT infrastructure.

960.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
960.title: Translation Of Legal And Financing Documents
960.description: Requires many consumer contracts to be translated from English to Spanish or Japanese under some circumstances.

961.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
961.title: Plumbers, Irrigators, And Water Systems Installers
961.description: Provides that a licensed individual sewage disposal system installer may, without further licensing, connect an existing sewer lateral pipe to a municipal or public sewer system.

962.title: Employment Applications
962.description: Gives the department of labor and training the jurisdiction to review claims alleging that employers had improperly inquired about an applicant’s criminal history on an employment application.

963.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
963.title: Hoisting Engineers
963.description: Adds a requirement to obtain a hoisting engineering license that a person possess a certificate of registration as a registered apprentice engineer.

964.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
964.title: Parental And Family Medical Leave
964.description: Grants unpaid pregnancy leave to part-time workers, clarifies their access to unpaid sick leave during their pregnancy, and provides additional protections for pregnant workers who work in the medical field.

965.title: Long-term Care Coordinating Council
965.description: Amends the membership of the long-term care coordinating council from forty-one (41) members to thirty-three (33) members.

967.title: Relating To Towns And Cities-award Of Municipal Contracts
967.description: Requires a city or town to utilize qualification based selection for the procurement of program managers, construction managers, or construction managers at risk.

971.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
971.title: Federal Aid
971.description: Requires free lunches to be provided for all elementary and secondary students attending public schools.

975.title: Health Insurance Coverage
975.description: Adopts the Health Insurance Market Stabilization and Consumer Protection Act of 2017.

976.title: State Crime Laboratory
976.description: Changes the director and other positions at the state crime laboratory from board of governors' appointments to employees of the council on postsecondary education.

977.title: Pesticide Control
977.description: Creates an exception to the registration requirements and registration fees for minor use pesticides.

979.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
979.title: Theodore Francis Green State Airport
979.description: Increases the yearly amount of money the state airport corporation pays to the city of Warwick as payment for the municipal services it provides to them from $500,000 to $1,400,000.

984.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Save The Neighborhoods
984.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Save The Neighborhoods

986.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
986.title: Electric Generation Service
986.description: Requires the public utilities commission to implement a purchase of receivables program where the electric distribution company purchases the receivables of a nonregulated power producer at a discount rate.

987.title: Right To Farm
987.description: Defines secondary agricultural operations and would provide that municipalities may limit and regulate secondary agricultural use if it is determined that the use is harmful to public safety, but may not prohibit such agricultural operations.

988.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
988.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation
988.description: Exempts from sales and use taxes specialized packaging equipment such as kegs for alcoholic beverages.

993.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
993.title: Regulatory Powers Of Administration--utilities
993.description: Characterizes incentive payments to utilities as billed distribution revenue for rate setting services.

994.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Simon's Supply, Co., Inc.
994.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Simon's Supply, Co., Inc.

996.title: Bristol Volunteer Firefighters Tax Relief
996.description: Enables the town of Bristol to provide tax relief to volunteer firefighters based upon certain qualifying criteria.

999.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendments To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Warren
999.description: Ratifies and validates the amendments to the Warren Home Rule Charter which were approved by the electors of the town of Warren at the polls on November 8, 2016.

1003.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1003.title: Relating To Alcoholic Beverages
1003.description: Prohibits individuals from completing alcohol-server training requirements from online or Internet sources.

1007.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1007.title: Relating To Public Property And Works-state Purchases
1007.description: Requires the state to procure professional architectural, engineering, and consultants services through a Qualifications Based Selection (QBS) process as required by the federal government for federally funded projects under the Brooks Act.

1010.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1010.title: Rhode Island Commerce Corporation
1010.description: Adds to the Rhode Island commerce corporation two (2) public members appointed by the governor, employed as senior managers in companies having the majority of their business in the defense industry and having facilities located in this state.

1011.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1011.title: Procedure Generally - Jury Lists
1011.description: Makes persons seventy (70) years of age or older eligible for exemption from jury service.

1013.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1013.title: Maintenance Of Town Highways
1013.description: Requires that any altered roadway be restored to the same or better condition that existed prior to the alteration, immediately after the completion of the alteration, and further establishes a daily penalty for failure to comply.

1016.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1016.title: Individualized Worker Savings Account Program Act
1016.description: Abolishes the current temporary disability insurance program and replace it with a more flexible, expansive and mandatory new program that compensates all workers who become disabled due to non-work related injuries.

1020.title: Days Of Special Observance
1020.description: Changes the recognition of Viet Nam Veterans' Day from May 15 to March 29 in order to correspond to the federal observance of this day.

1021.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1021.title: Mobile And Manufactured Home Lot Rental Increases
1021.description: Provides that an owner or operator of a mobile home park would not increase rent in an amount greater than the average annual increase of the Consumer Price Index for the preceding thirty-six (36) month period, unless under certain circumstances.

1022.title: Workers' Compensation--benefits
1022.description: Repeals a provision of the workers' compensation law that provides that for injuries on and after July 1, 2023, "material hindrance" includes only compensable injuries causing a greater than sixty-five percent (65%) degree of functional impairment.

1023.title: Stroke Prevention And Treatment Act Of 2009
1023.description: Permits the department of health to designate hospitals as "acute stroke ready hospitals."

1024.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1024.title: Woonsocket
1024.description: Creates several new subsections in the Woonsocket property tax code.

1027.title: Property Subject To Taxation--town Of Warren
1027.description: Increases various property tax exemptions available in the town of Warren.

1032.title: Authorizing The Town Of Lincoln To Issue Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not Exceeding $60,000,000 To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Rehabilitation, Repair, Improvements, Furnishing And Equipping Of And/or Additions To Lincoln High School And School Facilities In The Town
1032.description: Authorizes the town of Lincoln to issue bonds and notes in an amount not exceeding $60,000,000 to finance the improvements to Lincoln High School and school facilities in the town.

1033.title: Expiration Dates
1033.description: Grants the administrator of the division of motor vehicles the power to extend the expiration dates up to ninety (90) days of permits, licenses, registrations, certificates, placards, and other privileges, under limited circumstances.

1034.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
1034.title: Local Canvassing Authorities
1034.description: Clarifies that the authority of the president of a city or town council to nominate the members of a local canvassing authority only applies to a municipality that does not have a mayoral form of government.

1036.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1036.title: Involuntary Commitment Of Substance Abusers
1036.description: Provides for the involuntary commitment of drug and intoxicating substance abusers who are a danger to themselves or others.

1040.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1040.title: Long-term Managed Care Arrangements
1040.description: Requires managed care organizations to consult with the EOHHS to develop incentives for nursing facilities that demonstrate lower direct care staff turnover.

1041.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1041.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Special Plate For Rhode Island Boy Scouts
1041.description: Authorizes a special license plate for Rhode Island boy scouts, a nonprofit corporation, and establish the fees and other conditions applicable to its issuance.

1042.title: Pesticide Relief Fund
1042.description: Sets aside $500,000 for pesticide registration funds for DEM pest management program costs.

1045.title: School Funds And Property
1045.description: Establishes a pilot program to promote the creation of roof solar installations on school property in order to reduce the use of fossil fuels and to generate electricity in school buildings.

1046.title: Authorizing The Town Of Scituate To Issue General Obligation Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $4,900,000 To Finance Replacements, Renovations And Improvements Including A New Track And Field At The Scituate Public Schools
1046.description: Authorizes the town of Scituate to issue not more than $4,900,000 bonds and notes to finance various improvements at the town of Scituate's schools.

1048.title: Hospital Conversions
1048.description: Streamlines the procedure for the approval of mergers of not-for-profit hospitals and unaffiliated community hospitals.

1050.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1050.title: Driver Training Staff
1050.description: Permits CCRI to hire persons who are employed by, or associated with, commercial driving schools for the classroom instruction portion of the CCRI program.

1051.title: Relating To The Burrillville Land Trust
1051.description: Increases the tax exemption for real property held by the Burrillville Land Trust to two million dollars ($2,000,000).

1052.title: Ratification Of Charter Amendments
1052.description: Validates and ratifies amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of West Warwick, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of West Warwick on May 19, 2016.

1053.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1053.title: Relating To Human Services
1053.description: Authorizes HHS to apply for waivers to assure for housing, healthcare, and mental and behavioral health care services for the homeless.

1055.title: Electricians - Trades Licensing - Penalty For Violations
1055.description: Each individual violating law governing electricians, plumbers, and other trades constitutes a separate offense for firms/corporations.

1057.title: Rhode Island Regulatory Reform Act
1057.description: Requires the office of regulatory reform, in consultation with various state departments and plant-based and agriculture industry representatives, work to facilitate economic growth within plant-based industries and agriculture.

1058.title: Inspections Of Health Care Facilities
1058.description: Makes changes to the licensing procedures for health care facilities.

1060.title: The Rhode Island Health Care Reform Act Of 2004--health Insurance Oversight
1060.description: Requires the health insurance commissioner to make recommendations to the general assembly to ensure compliance with mental health parity provisions required by existing law.

1061.title: The I-195 Redevelopment Act Of 2011
1061.description: Requires the I-195 commission to conduct training for new commission members which would include training in ethics.

1062.title: Appointments Commissions
1062.description: Changes the responsibility of making appointments to certain advisory and exchange commissions from the lieutenant governor to the senate president.

1063.title: Stopping, Standing, And Parking Restrictions
1063.description: Creates a prohibition on parking in electric vehicle charging stations without using the charging apparatus.

1065.title: Department Of Environmental Management - Dock Safety
1065.description: Requires DEM to issue regulations requiring any dock or pier longer than twenty feet (20') and located on a freshwater lake or pond to be equipped with reflective material such that it can be seen by watercraft operators.

1066.title: Resilient Rhode Island Act Of 2014 - Climate Change Coordinating Council
1066.description: Directs the climate change coordinating council to study a carbon pricing program.

1067.title: Comprehensive Discharge Planning
1067.description: Requires medical treatment facilities to provide discharge plans for patients with nonsubstance abuse related mental health disorders.

1069.title: Automated External Defibrillators Required
1069.description: Requires an automated external defibrillator (AED) and qualified person to administer an AED at all public places capable of holding three hundred (300) people or more.

1070.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1070.title: Registration Of Nursing Assistants
1070.description: Allows for a nurse to delegate tasks to nursing assistants and authorizes the department of health to promulgate regulations that delineate delegable tasks.

1071.title: Home-visiting System Components
1071.description: Directs the department of health to obtain an annual estimate of the number of children born to Rhode Island families who face significant risk factors known to impair child development.

1073.title: Rhode Island Certification Standards Board
1073.description: Creates a reporting requirement for the commissioners of education and the council on elementary and secondary education concerning teacher training and the effect of new regulations.

1074.title: Social Services
1074.description: Defines and declares the purpose of child opportunity zones and would provide for annual reporting from the commissioner of elementary and secondary education to the general assembly on each zone.

1076.title: Veterans' Affairs
1076.description: Provides for changes to the veterans' services strategic plan advisory committee to provide coordination of state, federal, and private veterans' services.

1078.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1078.title: Rhode Island Pathways Project
1078.description: Requires the executive office of health and human services (EOHHS) to conduct a study to assess the impact of using Medicaid funds to provide coverage for the treatment of the chronically homeless.

1079.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1079.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
1079.description: Repeals the sunset provision of chapter 33.6 of title 44 which grants tax credits to individuals or companies redeveloping historic structures.

1083.title: Civic Education Commission
1083.description: Alters the membership, reporting protocol, and meeting requirements of the civic education commission.

1084.title: Establishment Of Public Charter Schools
1084.description: Provides that a charter public school that operates or will operate elementary school grades, middle school grades or high school grades shall be considered a network charter school notwithstanding the facility or the administration of the school.

1085.title: Registration Of Vehicles--combination Plates
1085.description: Increases the upper gross weight limit for vehicles eligible for a combination plate from eleven thousand four hundred pounds (11,400 lbs.) to eleven thousand eight hundred pounds (11,800 lbs.).

1086.title: Lenders And Loan Brokers
1086.description: Permits a borrower and a licensee to agree to interest and fees charged by the licensee if disclosure is made pursuant to 12 CFR Part 1026.

1088.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1088.title: Career And Technical Education
1088.description: Provides that the department of education would develop a funding formula for school districts sending students to career and technical programs outside the district.

1092.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1092.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles-motor Vehicles Reparation Act
1092.description: Penalizes driving any motor vehicle required to be registered in this or any state without insurance or proof of insurance and abolish requirement that operator knew the vehicle was uninsured or unregistered making them strict liability offenses.

1095.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions -- New Rhode Island Veterans Home Conference Room
1095.description: Names one of the two (2) new conference rooms at the Rhode Island Veterans Home as the "S. Michael Minutelli Memorial Conference Room".

1097.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1097.title: Comprehensive Community -- Police Relationship Act Of 2015
1097.description: Requires driver education programs to teach applicants prohibitions/obligations relating to traffic stops and procedure for filing complaint for any violations.

1098.title: Agricultural Functions Of The Department Of Environmental Management
1098.description: Authorizes the directors of the departments of environmental management and health to enforce the Federal Food Safety Modernization Act as it pertains to commercial growers of fruits and vegetables.

1099.title: Validating And Ratifying An Amendment To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Tiverton
1099.description: Validates and ratify amendments to the Home Rule Charter of the town of Tiverton, which amendments were adopted and approved by the electors of the town of Tiverton on November 8, 2016.

1100.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1100.title: Telephone Number Portability
1100.description: Allows users of telecommunications services to retain, within the same area code, existing phone numbers without impairment of quality, reliability, or convenience when switching from one telecommunications service provider to another.

1103.title: The Healthy Pregnancies For Incarcerated Women Act
1103.description: Prohibits the use of restraints on pregnant prisoners in their third trimester during transport to and from court proceedings by sheriffs and/or incarceration at the ACI with annual reports to the general assembly effective January 1, 2018.

1104.title: Cardiac Arrest Prevention In School Sports
1104.description: Addresses the potential for sudden cardiac arrest among student athletes by raising awareness of the symptoms ad requiring medical evaluations.

1105.title: Rhode Island Veterans' Home - Advisory Council
1105.description: Reduces the number of advisory council members from twenty-seven (27) to fifteen (15) and eliminates the duty of the advisory council to advise the administrator of the veterans' home.

1107.title: Real Estate Exemption
1107.description: Updates the definition of visually impaired persons to conform to the federal standard based upon medical advances and to assure a uniform application by all municipalities in granting the exemption.

1109.title: Credit For Reinsurance Act
1109.description: Amends reinsurance credit statute to conform with NAIC model/surplus lines statute for taxation of fees/protected cell statute as to business transfer with insolvency protection/insurance premium tax statute defining qualifying jobs.

1110.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1110.title: Redevelopment Agencies And Projects
1110.description: Permits redevelopment agencies to finance the construction of projects for residential, recreational, commercial, industrial, institutional, public, or other purposes contemplated by a redevelopment plan.

1111.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Evolution Studios, L.l.c.
1111.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Evolution Studios, L.l.c.

1114.title: The Hospital Conversions Act
1114.description: Provides that a release of a joint tortfeasor in a judicially approved settlement of claims relating to the St. Joseph Health Services of Rhode Island Retirement Plan shall not discharge other joint tortfeasors unless it so provides.

1115.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Johnston Little League
1115.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Johnston Little League

1116.title: Tuition For Active Duty Military
1116.description: Grants instate tuition status at state operated schools to active duty and reserve members stationed in Rhode Island.

1117.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tabor Franchi Post 2396 Veterans Of Foreign Wars

1990.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Beta Alpha Chapter Of Delta Zeta Sorority House Corporation

1996.title: Relating To Financial Institutions--credit Unions
1996.description: Transfers the expulsion power of members to credit union management from the board of directors, provides written notice to the member of expulsion, and establishes a ten (10) business day appeal procedure to the board of directors.

2002.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2002.title: Relating To Taxation-personal Income Tax
2002.description: Subtracts from the federal adjusted gross income, recovery of Rhode Island income taxes attributable to any amount deducted for federal income taxes in any prior tax year for the purposes of calculation of the same income tax.

2023.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2023.title: The Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act
2023.description: Establishes an early childhood innovation fund to help close the achievement gap for at-risk children as they enter kindergarten

2036.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
2036.title: Labeling Of Genetically Engineered Raw And Packaged Food Products
2036.description: Requires that all genetically engineered food offered for retail sale in this state have a label disclosing that the food is genetically engineered food upon the occurrence of 4 other states adopting similar labeling laws as specified in this act.

2065.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Wakefield Fire Department Of The Union Fire District In South Kingstown R.i.
2065.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Wakefield Fire Department Of The Union Fire District In South Kingstown R.i.

2067.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2067.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-assaults
2067.description: Makes an assault or battery upon a dwarf resulting in bodily injury a felony and would be punishable by up to three (3) years imprisonment and an assault resulting in serious bodily injury punishable by to twenty (20) years imprisonment.

2073.title: Department Of Environmental Management--marine Fisheries
2073.description: Creates division of marine fisheries within DEM to manage saltwater fish and plant harvesting.

2074.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
2074.title: Implementation Of The Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative Act
2074.description: Provides that proceeds from the auction or sale of allowances to emit a fixed amount of carbon dioxide may be used to promote cost-effective energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies, zero emission vehicles and charging stations.

2095.title: Emergency Management
2095.description: Amends the composition of the Rhode Island emergency management advisory council.

2097.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2097.title: Relating To Elections
2097.description: Requires write-in candidates to file a declaration of intent (7) days prior to the election. Write-in votes would be counted for those filing declarations only unless no candidate appeared on the ballot.

2105.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2105.title: Courts - Commission On Judicial Tenure And Discipline
2105.description: Imposes certain discovery obligations/procedural changes upon judicial tenure/discipline commission regarding removal of judges.

2106.title: Coverage For Infertility
2106.description: Mandates insurance coverage for medically necessary expenses for standard fertility preservation services when a medical treatment may directly or indirectly cause iatrogenic infertility.

2109.title: Health Insurance Coverage -- The Market Stability And Consumer Protection Act
2109.description: Adopts the Health Insurance Market Stabilization and Consumer Protection Act of 2017.

2117.title: Noncompete Agreements - Broadcast Employees
2117.description: Prohibits the inclusion of noncompete agreements in broadcast industry employment contracts that are entered into after January 1, 2018.

2119.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2119.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-electronic Tracking Of Motor Vehicles
2119.description: Provides that it is not a violation if the installation or use of an electronic tracking device in or on a motor vehicle is by, or at the direction of a licensed private detective or a licensed bail bondsman in the scope of their lawful duties.

2122.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Silver Lake Pizza, Inc.
2122.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Silver Lake Pizza, Inc.

2125.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies - Step Therapy Protocol
2125.description: Requires health insurers, nonprofit hospital service corporations, nonprofit medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations that issue policies that provide coverage for prescription drugs and use step therapy protocols.

2131.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2131.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers--regulatory Powers Of Administration--utilities
2131.description: Characterizes incentive payments to utilities as billed distribution revenue for rate setting services.

2134.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2134.title: Casualty Insurance Generally
2134.description: Exempts residential property from vacancy definition provided property owner in process of rehabilitation/renovation pursuant to the issuance of building permits by local municipality.

2144.title: Airports And Landing Fields
2144.description: Permits the department of transportation to lease our airport property for a period of fifty (50) years and requires one member of the airport corporation board of directors to have a pilot's license.

2151.title: Post Retirement Income
2151.description: Allows a retired member of the teachers, state employees; or municipal retirement system to serve as an elected town treasurer without a suspension of their retirement benefits.

2153.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
2153.title: Self Service Storage Facilities
2153.description: Authorizes the owner of a self-storage facility to notify an occupant who has been defaulted, of the default, by verified electronic mail.

2156.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2156.title: Veterans' Exemptions
2156.description: Eliminates the requirement that a service person serving in conflicts or undeclared wars receive a campaign ribbon or expeditionary medal in order to receive a property tax exemption.

2161.title: Industrial Facilities Corporation
2161.description: Exempts projects governed by the RI Industrial Facilities Corporation Act and approved after 6/30/2017, from the payment of sales tax applicable to materials/furniture/fixtures/equipment used in the construction/reconstruction/rehab of the project.

2162.title: Rebuild Rhode Island Tax Credit
2162.description: Adds a definition for "manufacturer" for purposes of providing a tax credit application exemption to certain projects under the RI Tax Credit Act to include occupants that are manufacturers.

2166.title: Relating To Elections-nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates-city Of Woonsocket
2166.description: Provides that nomination papers for certain candidates for citywide nonpartisan office in the city of Woonsocket would require at least one hundred (100) signatures.

2167.title: Licensure Streamlining In The Town Of Warren
2167.description: Authorizes the Warren town council, by ordinance, to administratively issue and renew all licenses the council is authorized to issue pursuant to state law, except those licenses that require a public hearing.

2169.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2169.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions – Contractors’ Registration And Licensing Board
2169.description: Requires an applicant for any license or registration issued by the contractors’ registration and licensing board to undergo a national criminal records check.

2176.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
2176.title: Solar Energy Permitting
2176.description: Promotes the development and utilization of solar energy systems by reducing local burdens on the development process thereto.

2180.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2180.title: Retirement System -- Contributions And Benefits
2180.description: Addresses the age-related disparate treatment of state employees who were eligible to retire by reason of age on June 30, 2012. The act exempts these employees from the 401(a) plan, and return them to the traditional defined benefit plan.

2183.title: Division Of Motor Vehicles -- Expiration Dates
2183.description: Grants the department of motor vehicles administrator the ability to extend expiration dates under certain circumstances that prevent the proper performance of their duties.

2191.title: Relating To Public Officers And Employees – Retirement Of Municipal Employees And Closed Municipal Retirement Plans
2191.description: Makes it more efficient for municipal retirement plans to join the state municipal employees retirement system, by providing greater flexibility in funding policies depending on the circumstances of each municipal plan.

2200.title: Relating To Creating The Rhode Island Commission For National And Community Service
2200.description: Creates a 25 member RI commission for national community service in the department of education to work with a nonprofit corporation of the same name created in 1994 to prepare and implement a 3 yr. community service plan.

2207.title: Central Falls Police And Fire Retiree Pension Benefits
2207.description: Provides that all city employees covered by Central Falls retirees' settlement agreement would have benefits gradually increased over five years from 75% base to 87.5% base pension benefit amount.
